intro: Pharus glaber, commonly known as the smooth pharus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. Pharus glaber is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
